intro: Begonia mamapachensis, commonly known as the Mamapaché begonia, is a flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and vibrant flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and bright red or orange bracts that surround its small, delicate flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
